NAV.title: Navigation & Passage Planning
NAV.purpose: To develop the cadet’s understanding of safe navigation principles, voyage planning, and situational awareness during coastal and ocean passages.

DC.NAV.01.title: Prepare a berth-to-berth passage plan
DC.NAV.01.purpose: To ensure the cadet understands structured voyage planning and the importance of preparing a complete passage plan in accordance with company procedures and applicable regulations.
whatToDo: Review the intended voyage and obtain relevant charts and publications
Prepare a berth-to-berth passage plan under the supervision of a navigating officer
Mark courses, distances, wheel-over positions, and reporting points as required
howToDemonstrate: Explain the prepared passage plan to the officer in charge of the watch
Demonstrate understanding of each leg of the voyage
Answer questions related to the planning process and assumptions made
DC.NAV.01.notes: This task should normally be demonstrated during an actual voyage where practicable.

DC.NAV.02.title: Apply chart corrections and verify navigational publications
DC.NAV.02.purpose: To ensure the cadet understands the importance of using corrected charts and up-to-date publications for safe navigation.
whatToDo: Identify charts and publications required for the intended voyage
Apply corrections using notices to mariners or electronic updates under supervision
Verify that charts and publications are corrected and ready for use
howToDemonstrate: Show corrected charts or electronic chart status to the officer
Explain the correction process and sources of information
Answer questions on the consequences of using uncorrected charts
DC.NAV.02.notes: Electronic and paper chart systems may both be used, depending on the vessel.

DC.NAV.03.title: Identify navigational hazards and contingency measures
DC.NAV.03.purpose: To develop the cadet’s ability to recognize navigational hazards and plan appropriate contingency measures to maintain safety of navigation.
whatToDo: Identify hazards along the planned route such as shallow waters, traffic density, or restricted areas
Discuss potential risks associated with these hazards
Identify suitable contingency measures or alternative actions
howToDemonstrate: Point out hazards on the chart or electronic display
Explain proposed contingency actions to the officer
Respond to scenario-based questions related to navigational risks
DC.NAV.03.notes: Hazards may vary depending on trading area and voyage conditions.

DC.NAV.04.title: Explain bridge equipment used during navigation
DC.NAV.04.purpose: To ensure the cadet understands the function and limitations of bridge equipment used to support safe navigation.
whatToDo: Identify the main navigation equipment fitted on the bridge
Observe the use of equipment during watchkeeping
Learn the basic operating principles and limitations of each system
howToDemonstrate: Explain the purpose and basic operation of bridge equipment to the officer
Demonstrate awareness of limitations and common errors
Answer questions related to the safe use of navigation equipment
DC.NAV.04.notes: Equipment may include radar, ECDIS, gyrocompass, GPS, and other fitted systems.
